FuncDef:
The traffic-statistics peer enable command enables traffic statistics collection for a PW in VPLS multi-homing scenarios.
The undo traffic-statistics peer enable command disables traffic statistics collection of a PW in VPLS multi-homing scenarios.
By default, traffic statistics collection is disabled from PWs in VPLS multi-homing scenarios.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the peer IP address of a PW.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before checking PW traffic statistics in VPLS multi-homing scenarios, run the traffic-statistics peer enable command to enable traffic statistics collection. These statistics help you learn network operating status.
Prerequisites
VPLS multi-homing has been enabled using the pwsignal bgp multi-homing command.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the display traffic-statistics vsi vsi [ peer peer-address ] command to check traffic statistics about a PW.Before running the traffic-statistics peer command, run the reset traffic-statistics vsi vsi-name [ peer peer-address ] command to clear VPLS PW traffic statistics.
